### Governance Rules in Purview #### Overview - **Definition**: Governance rules are policies and procedures that manage and regulate data usage. - **Purpose**: Ensures data integrity, security, and compliance with industry standards. #### Main Components - **Automated Enforcement**: Uses workflows to apply data policies automatically. - **Data Classification**: Labels data based on sensitivity levels. - **Access Control**: Restricts data access to authorized users only. - **Compliance Monitoring**: Tracks and reports adherence to regulatory requirements. - **Audit Trails**: Maintains logs of data activities for transparency. #### Implementing Governance Rules - **Assessment**: Evaluate current data practices and identify areas for improvement. - **Policy Development**: Create detailed policies that cover data handling. - **Training**: Educate employees on data governance policies. - **Technology Integration**: Use tools like Purview for policy implementation. - **Regular Reviews**: Periodically assess and update governance rules. #### Benefits - **Risk Mitigation**: Reduces the chance of data breaches. - **Compliance**: Ensures adherence to legal standards. - **Operational Efficiency**: Streamlines processes and improves data usage. - **Trust**: Builds confidence among stakeholders and customers. ### Action Items 1. Engage with Purview tutorials for practical insights. 2. Explore the Purview portal to understand its functionalities. 3. Integrate compliance frameworks
